repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.abstract: This collection contains correspondence, notes, financial documents, licensing agreements, programs, flyers, DVDs, photographs, printed media reviews, and other records related to the operation of Eric Hampton Dance. The material, which dates from 1981 to 2012. The Washington area dance company was founded in 1991 by choreographer and ballet instructor Eric Hampton.
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

Copyright of the choreography, as shown in the various recordings, rests with either the heirs of Eric Hampton or the Maryland Youth Ballet and cannot be performed without consent of the copyright holder.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Eric Hampton Dance (EHD) was founded in 1991 by Eric Hampton, revered ballet instructor and talented choreographer. The purpose of the company was to bring Hampton's unique vision of classically inspired contemporary movement to audiences throughout the Washington, D.C. area. EHD attracted distinguished dancers and earned both local and national praise. The company received funding from various arts foundations, including the DC Commission on the Arts and Humanities, the National Endowment for the Arts, the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, the Maryland Youth Ballet, the Morris and Gwendolyn Cafritz Foundation, and the Eugene and Agnes E. Meyer Foundation. Eric Hampton Dance also had annual benefits to raise money and support for the Whitman-Walker Clinic, a non-profit health center specializing in HIV/AIDS and LGBT health care for the D.C. area.

Eric Hampton (1947-2001) was a distinguished choreographer and dance instructor in the Washington, D.C. area. Hampton graduated from Interlochen Arts Academy and the Juilliard School of Dance. In 1969, he moved to Europe and joined the Netherlands Dance Theater and the Scapino Ballet. In 1978, Hampton returned to the U.S. where he joined the Washington Ballet as a soloist and resident choreographer. During this time, he also directed his own dance studio, Dance Downtown, until 1986. In 1981, Hampton became a faculty member and resident choreographer for the Maryland Youth Ballet. In 1991, Hampton founded his own company, Eric Hampton Dance. Harriet Moncure Fellows (n√©e Williams), one of Hampton's fellow instructors at the Maryland Youth Ballet, became his artistic assistant at EHD. Tragically, Mr. Hampton was diagnosed with Lou Gehrig's disease (ALS) in 1997 and passed away in February 2001 at the age of 54. After his death, Hampton's works were left in the care of his close friend and colleague, Harriet Moncure Fellows. In 2012, Fellows helped establish the Eric Hampton Dance Foundation (EHDF) which licenses Hampton's choreographic work. Fellows holds the positions of President and Treasurer at EHDF. Elisa Clark, who received training from Eric Hampton and the Maryland Youth Ballet, is currently the Director of Repertory for the foundation.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, notes, financial documents, licensing agreements, programs, flyers, DVDs, photographs, and printed media reviews. The material dates from 1981 to 2012. These are records related to the operation of Eric Hampton Dance. Eric Hampton Dance was founded in 1991 by choreographer and ballet instructor Eric Hampton.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into 3 series: Management, marketing, and fundraising files, Performance files, and Reviews and publicity files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials in this series include marketing packets, grant applications, tax information, donor correspondence, Board of Directors communication, newsletters, photographs, resumes, position descriptions, fundraising, budgets, and event planning. They range in date from 1988 to 2005, and represent the more formal business and management aspects of Eric Hampton Dance.

did.unittitle: Programs - Advertising and Thank You Letters
Dancers - Board Communication Consent/Release Forms & Policies
Photocopies of Photographs from EHD at the Kennedy Center
Maryland Youth Ballet - Benefit and Fundraising Materials

Eric Hampton CV and Biographical Notes

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into 3 subseries: Programs and special event materials, Music rights agreements, and Audiovisual materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials in this series include correspondence, licensing agreements, dance programs, flyers, schedules, invoices, and DVD footage of various dance performances. They range in date from 1989 to 2012, and represent the performances and special events planned by Eric Hampton Dance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials in this subseries include music rights correspondence and licensing agreements for Eric Hampton Dance performances. The material dates from 1991 to 2001, and it represents the types of songs and performances done by Eric Hampton Dance at this time.

did.unittitle: Theodore Presser Co. - "La Revue de Cuisine"
Durand et Cie - "Le Tombeau de Couperin"
"How Do I Love Thee" - Music Licensing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials in this subseries include dance programs, flyers, event schedules, invoices, and other materials related to Eric Hampton Dance performances. The materials range in date from 1989 to 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries inlcudes 6 DVDs containing footage of various dance performances involving Eric Hampton or Eric Hampton Dance. The materials range in date from 1995 to 2001.

did.unittitle: DVD: "Senseless Acts of Beauty" - Eric Hampton Dance
DVD: Eric Hampton Dance - "Let Me Count the Ways" Concert
DVD: Eric Hampton Dance presents "Prayers and Nightmares"
DVD: Eric Hampton Memorial Concert - Maryland Youth Ballet and Friends
DVD: Selected Excerpts from the Choreography of Eric Hampton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials in this series include newspaper clippings and online printouts of Eric Hampton Dance event listings, reviews, articles, and interviews. They range in date from 1981 to 2002, and represent Eric Hampton and his dance company's standing in the local community. This series also contains materials related to Eric Hampton's personal battle with ALS and his death in 2001.
